detailed_results.input: The Romans, in the countries which they annexed, observed closely these measures; they sent colonies and maintained friendly relations with the minor powers, without increasing their strength; they kept down the greater, and did not allow any strong foreign powers to gain authority.
detailed_results.reasoning: The prediction changes several key aspects: the coalition is 'Rome' instead of 'Romans' (possibly acceptable), but more importantly, it adds and changes predicates: 'colonies_sent' vs 'send-colony' (likely fine), but adds '!stronger', 'big_controlled', and '!strong_foreign_power_allowed', which are not present in the gold and may not be direct translations of the input. The gold focuses on three conjuncts: sending colonies, friendly with minor powers, and keeping down the greater. The prediction splits and adds more conditions, changing the expressed property.

detailed_results.input: Given three robots, none of them has a strategy to ensure that whenever position 2 holds, position 1 will hold in the next step.
detailed_results.gold: !<<Robot1>> G (pos2 -> X pos1) && !<<Robot2>> G (pos2 -> X pos1) && !<<Robot3>> G (pos2 -> X pos1)
detailed_results.reasoning: The prediction changes both the coalition and the temporal/strategic structure. The gold expresses that no individual robot can guarantee the property globally (G), with negation outside each agent's ability. The prediction instead gives a joint coalition (all three robots together) and only an X (next) operator, not G (globally), and lacks the negation. This does not capture the intended meaning that none of the robots individually can ensure the property at all times.

detailed_results.input: The Parties agree that an armed attack against one or more of them in Europe or North America shall be considered an attack against them all and consequently they agree that, if such an armed attack occurs, each of them, in exercise of the right of individual or collective self-defence recognised by Article 51 of the Charter of the United Nations, will assist the Party or Parties so attacked by taking forthwith, individually and in concert with the other Parties, such action as it deems necessary, including the use of armed force, to restore and maintain the security of the North Atlantic area.
detailed_results.reasoning: The prediction changes the coalition from 'Parties' (all parties) to only 'Country1, Country2', which is a significant semantic change. It also changes the temporal structure from 'U' (until) to 'G (-> F ...)', which is not equivalent: the gold expresses that the attack continues until security is restored, while the prediction expresses that whenever an attack occurs, assistance will eventually be given. This does not capture the same guarantee or temporal relationship.
